Posts.Content: sunny10 wrote: Hi, I'm trying not to worry or feel concerned but my Dr. requested a mamogram and a BSGI.  My story is:  In April 2007 I had fibroademoma removed from my right breast.  It was removed by the freezing procedure.  (Visica).  The bump I had discovered on my right breast went away but I started to feel pain about 1 year later. But before this happened I went to  my Gyno for my annual exam in Jan. 2010...she found a lump that she wanted me to have seen thru ultrasound on my LEFT breast.  I told her I had my own Dr. I saw for ultrasounds and had removed a fibroademoa so I would schedule an appt with him again.  Because I was experiecing pain in my right breast thought I would talk to him about both issues.  I had my appt today.  Without telling him what my Gyno had found on my LEFT breast he immedialty saw and felt the lump with the ultrasound. When he did the ultrasound and felt my right breast....he told me he saw fibrosistic (sp?) activity in my RIGHT breast where the fibroademoa had been removed.  He said my body tissue may not have healed up well possibly?  He has to call my insurance and request the mamogram and BSGI.  He will be calling me back so I can schdule both.  He said he wants to make sure there are no high levels of activity (cancer??) and the BSGI will  help him see that.  I've never had a mamogram and he wants me to have one as well.  I will be honest and say I was nervous and may not have asked all the questions I should have.  I have read many questions on this Forum and it seems it is very normal to feel anxious about what is NEXT after my mamogram and BSGI (if my insurance approves).  When I had the fibroademoa procedure I did not experience AT ALL what I am now...I guess the word mamogram scares me b/c no one my age I know has ever had to  have one.  I've read of rare cases where its necessary.  If you read thru this whole thing, "thank you". I'm just venting to someone...I dont want to tell my  mom b/c I know she will freak out.  I have a younger sister (24) who also had a fibroadenoma removed and my poor mom was so worried :(  I don't want to blow things out of context and I'm hoping this "worried" feeling I feel is very common.      Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: BSGI at my age? 28yrs old sunny10 sunny10
BSGI at my age? 28yrs old sunny10 sunny10

Posts.Content: Aug 26, 2010 11:06AM sunny10 wrote: Lynne,  Thank you for reading my post and taking the time to reply.  Its a relief to know that many women have experienced this feeling.  I think this website is a great support :)  I'll keep things posted.    take care
